brainly_data.question: If a large Rubik's cube has a volume of 1331 cubic inches what is its surface area ?
brainly_data.subject: Mathematics

all_answers.question: If a large Rubik's cube has a volume of 1331 cubic inches what is its surface area ?
all_answers.subject: Mathematics
all_answers.text: This cube would have a surface area of 726 inches squared. To get this you take the cube root of 1331 to get 11. This 11 is a side length so you use it to find the area of a side: 11*11 = 121. Then multiply this 121 by 6 because there are 6 sides to a cube and get 726.

top_answer.question: If a large Rubik's cube has a volume of 1331 cubic inches what is its surface area ?
top_answer.subject: Mathematics
top_answer.text: This cube would have a surface area of 726 inches squared. To get this you take the cube root of 1331 to get 11. This 11 is a side length so you use it to find the area of a side: 11*11 = 121. Then multiply this 121 by 6 because there are 6 sides to a cube and get 726.
